intro: Muiriantha hassellii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the winter months, which are highly ornamental. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Muiriantha hassellii is well adapted to dry, rocky environments and requires well-drained soil.
